Thomas Sowell - Basic Economics: A Citizens Guide to the Economy


Bitrate: 32 kbps

"Economics is the study of the use of scarce resources which have alternative uses."

At last there is a citizen's guide to the economy, written by an economist who uses plain English. Thomas Sowell explains exactly what economics is and what its guiding principles are. No jargon, no graphs, no equations in this comprehensive survey, from scarcity, the balance of trade, and price controls to minimum-wage laws, competition, profits, losses and the role of government. Intended as a primer for the citizen not trained in the basics of economic theory.
